title: Instructional Design Program for Medical Continuing Education (CME) and Entrustable Professional Activity (EPA) Development

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of Basic Medical Education or Understanding of Core Instructional Design Concepts
context.additional_context: Blended education program strengthening CME program development capabilities by applying Kern’s 6-stage curriculum design model

learning_goals: Learners can conduct needs analysis for CME programs by applying Kern’s 6-step instructional design model.
Learners can design EPA (Entrustable Professional Activities)-based educational modules and develop assessment tools.
Learners can devise an implementation and feedback collection system for CME programs in blended learning environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
